repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
We usually shorten these to `opts` ;)
```suggestion
typehierarchy({kind}, {opts})                 *vim.lsp.buf.typehierarchy()*
```

You can even make the entire table a shared variable:
```suggestion
    config = config or {}
    local list = { title = 'LSP type hierarchy', items = items, context = ctx }

    if config.loclist then
      vim.fn.setloclist(0, {}, ' ', list)
      api.nvim_command('lopen')
    elseif config.on_list then
      assert(type(config.on_list) == 'function', 'on_list is not a function')
      config.on_list(list)
    else
      vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', list)
      api.nvim_command('botright copen')
    end
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -593,8 +593,19 @@ local function make_type_hierarchy_handler()
         col = col + 1,
       })
     end
-    vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', { title = 'LSP type hierarchy', items = items })
-    api.nvim_command('botright copen')
+    config = config or {}
+    local title = 'LSP type hierarchy'
+
+    if config.loclist then
+      vim.fn.setloclist(0, {}, ' ', { title = title, items = items, context = ctx })
+      api.nvim_command('lopen')
+    elseif config.on_list then
+      assert(type(config.on_list) == 'function', 'on_list is not a function')
+      config.on_list({ title = title, items = items, context = ctx })
+    else
+      vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', { title = title, items = items, context = ctx })
+      api.nvim_command('botright copen')
+    end

comment_data.body: Ah right, I basically copied this from `vim.lsp.buf.references()` which also calls this `options` instead of `opts`, we should probably change that as well then?

> I basically copied this from `vim.lsp.buf.references()` which also calls this `options` instead of `opts`, we should probably change that as well then?

yes. shorter is better. and "options" means something very different in vim/nvim.
Right, I added an additional commit that fixes this for all other functions in buf.lua

Maybe its something with my browser, but there seems to be some trailing whitespace here (?). Assuming you didn't modify these files manually and instead ran `make doc`, this might be a bug in the doc generator (cc @lewis6991)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1245,30 +1245,30 @@ add_workspace_folder({workspace_folder})
 clear_references()                            *vim.lsp.buf.clear_references()*
     Removes document highlights from current buffer.
 
-code_action({options})                             *vim.lsp.buf.code_action()*
+code_action({opts})                                *vim.lsp.buf.code_action()*

comment_data.body: This is not the end of the line, so it's not trailing whitespace. The whitespace is needed to align the tags.

comment_data.body: is this different from `request_with_opts` which was merged in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28637 ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,6 +47,17 @@ local function request_with_opts(name, params, opts)
   request(name, params, req_handler)
 end
 
+--- Calls client.request with the given `opts`.
+local function client_request_with_options(client, name, params, opts, bufnr)

comment_regular_data.body: Latest push fixes the lua warning about a shadowed parameter. Is there any way to disable the next.txt check? Or do we just ignore it?
news for *feat* change scope will skip it.

> news for _feat_ change scope will skip it.

Right, but I think `feat` is appropiate here, isn't it? Or should this be a `fix` instead?

Thanks for the review again!

I noticed that the `loclist` key to `vim.lsp.ListOpts` is not actually documented, but most LSP handlers still support it (e.g. references, documentSymbols, workspaceSymbol). There are some LSP handlers though that do not support it (declaration, definition, typeDefinition, implementation). Should I fix this in this PR as well, or maybe open a new one instead?
All suggestions should be applied now, I moved the cleanup to a new PR: #28637
This has been closed since a request for information has not been answered for 30 days. It can be reopened when the requested information is provided.
